artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Sasaki Toyokichi; Carver: Noguchi Enkatsu
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 509.1; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 228, p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: standing woman, slightly leaning forward, at the edge of water with small waves behind her and moon in sky, holding her loose hair in each hand in front of her shoulders; woman wears garment which is predominately patterned with purple and white triangles and starbursts in blue, green and gold, with red undergarment
markings: Artist’s seal: 大蘇 {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 円活刀 {Enkatsu tō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Collection of Thirty-six Ghosts in New Style (Shinkei sanjūrokkaisen 新形三十六怪撰)
title: Picture of Kiyo-hime Assuming a Serpent Form at Hidaka River
